page.title: 09The Old Lewes Race Course
page.content: We interviewed Mrs Ffitch-Hayes,the wife of the man who owns the race course buildings.She told us that when the race course was used for race meetings it was two miles all the way round but now some of the courshas disappeared.The race course contains two fences and three hurdles and when we went to look at the two fences they were just over half a metre high. The race course is used twice a week for training the horses.They exercise for one and a half hours each day. There are 14 stables and some of them are rented out,but there is always at night one horse in each box.Fast Flight is the fastest horse and the most recent horse is Calagat.He cost Â£1500.They feed their horses on bran, hay and racing cubes.They employ three or four grooms depending on the season.
